name: Abel Tasman Motor Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came across this little motel on our honeymoon roadtrip. After having a quick the round the town only to be told 'it is better in summer' we found the Abel Tasman Inn.
reviews.title: Friendly owner

reviews.text: The owner was friendly and gave us a quick look at the room prior to checking in. The room itself did have a view over the main road to the lagoon front where the wildlife could be seen. Noise was not too bad, but maybe it was low season.
reviews.title: nice views
Nothing fancy, the big road is very close.
reviews.text: Room itself had a mini kitchenette with fridge and was fairly clean. It has a small pool area, but it was too chilly to use!

description: The Abel Tasman Motor Lodge (AAA 3½ Star) goal is to make your stay a highly satisfying and memorable experience and the following features are available for guests: all rooms have lake views; fully serviced spacious suites with queen beds; kitchenette suites with microwave and cooking facilities(Hot plate & Grill Some with Ovens); quiet remote control split system heating/cooling; Free guest laundry (washing and drying); off- street parking; 32 inch televisions, DVD players in all rooms; Over 500 Complementary DVDs available from reception; sunny, secluded, sheltered, solar heated pool; outside undercover Free barbecue and eating area
